Winter Update from Mayor Lynn Clark

Winter Update From : The Desk of Mayor Lynn Clark,

Looks like the winter weather is almost past us! Although the sun is shining and main roads look better; please use extreme caution on the side roads as they are pretty slick.

Hickory Creek Town offices will have a delayed opening at noon on Tuesday, January 27 due to ongoing safety risk with travel. Hickory Creek Public Works Department will remain on standby and our Police Department continues to be in full operation.

We appreciate the collaboration and dedication from Judge Eads and Denton County Emergency Team. They provided daily updates and communications regarding the storm, ongoing operations, and potential hazards for our area.

In the event of a weather-related power outage, burst water pipes, safety hazards, or other issues please contact:

Oncor Call 888.313.4747, text “OUT” to 66267, or visit

CoServ Call 844.330.0762 or visit

Atmos Emergency call 866-322-8667

LCMUA Call 940.497.2999

Harbor Grove Water Supply: 940.497.9649 or 940.231.0710

Call or text Jeffrey McSpedden 469.576.5094

Call or text John Smith 469.763.2656

The Police Department will continue to work 24-hour operations. In case of an emergency, please call 911. If you need an officer dispatched to your location for a non-emergency, please call Denton County Dispatch at 940.349.1600 - Option 1.

8 a.m. – 7:30 p.m., 7 days a week

1508 E. McKinney St. 7 a.m. – 9 p.m., 7 days a week

509 N. Bell Ave.

1001 Parvin St.

MLK Jr. Rec Center

2001 W. Windsor Dr.

332 E. Hickory St.

Frederick Herring Parks & Recreation Center Friday starting at 5 p.m. through Monday at 12 p.m.
